6. **Bug Tracking**: Git can be used to track bugs and issues, making it easier to identify and fix problems in the codebase.
7. **Feature Branching**: Git allows developers to create feature branches, which enables them to work on new features independently of the main codebase
golden_answer: Git is commonly used for tracking changes in source code during software development.
